dashboard.label: Dashboard Refresh
dashboard.description: Enable dashboard elements to auto-refresh, optimizing the view experience for continuous monitoring of insights

html.p: Enable the behavior of a real-time dashboard. Introducing the enhanced dashboard refresh experience, giving users more control over the schedule and display behavior of dashboards to optimize for the given view experience. The net-result, create dashboards that can more effectively be used for continuous monitoring of insights, whether that be from a side-monitor on a workstation or an overhead display in an operations center.

ul.li: Configurable Refresh Indicator - Choose the desired refresh behavior (Preview, ProgressBar, None)
Moved Refresh Control to Search Manager - This enables users to setup refresh even for global searches
Configurable Refresh Schedule Type - Choose between interval-based or delay-based refresh times (delay is recommended)
UI Controls Support - Configuring refresh time and behavior is fully supported in the UI search editor for each element

html.p: Sample XML with the new refresh controls:
html.pre:
<chart> <!-- Set the refresh time and type (delay || interval) directly in the search object --> <search> <query>index=_internal| timechart count</query> <earliest>-7d@d</earliest> <latest>now</latest> <refresh>30s</refresh> <refreshType>delay</refreshType> </search>
<!-- Set the refresh behavior between "none", "progressbar", and "preview" --> <option name="refresh.display">preview</option> </chart>
